Posts.Content: I have had all my treatment in Germany,the hardest thing for me was the language barrier,and that was no ones fault,I have at times felt very frustrated,frightened unsure.But never once did I not believe that the medics were doing the best they could for me,here there is no mamby pambying,the Germans are very efficiant,abrupt and straight to the point there is no privacy on the wards, no reasuring words from the nurses their job seemed to be more about medical than emotional support,nothing in the way of aftercare or lovely little group meetings ie ; Look good feel good,Ive often read comments on here and been quite jealous of the things offered to plenty in the UK.I have had to find out information and have reports medically translated for myself.I researched the chemos I was to be given,made sure I was well prepared for any potential side affects,and just basically got on with it,I was and have been however very lucky in that I didnt have trouble with my bloods. I AM JUST VERY GRATEFUL TO BE ALIVE. This has been the biggest rollercoaster ride of my life,One that I have lived through.I intent to make the most of it,however tough things are always try to find positives and keep a good state of mind,I have no friends or family here,and without this mental attitude at times I might have rolled over and gave in. Good luck to all on here and stay strong...xx
Posts.Title: Getting them to listen

Posts.Content: Wow blue 70 what a shitty time you,ve had,As hard as it has been for me living here,I cant fault the medical care I have recieved,I am due to move back to the UK this weekend Salisbury area,I hope that the hospital there provides good care,I still have unanswered questions so im looking forward to hopefully speaking to an oncologist and finding the answeres I need.I certainly do not have any fond memories since this whole episode started,Im just so bloomin relieved that I got through the treatment which at times I really didnt think I would,I only stayed out of hospital because of my intense dislike of the way they are here,Im actually looking forward to attending a Look Good Feel Good class,I look pretty hideous,my hair although growing has a will of its own,now have sparse eyelashes,no brows,will be nice for someone to show me how to look human again,.lol....I hope you are feeling a bit better and good luck with the rest of your treatment..xx
Posts.Title: Getting them to listen

Posts.Content: Hi,I had my final appointment with consultant this week (I will be moving back to the UK next week ) and she said that my joint and muscle pain is most definately caused by the Taxotere,she said she hasnt met 1 lady yet who hasnt suffered from it, in a similar way from the same drug,Basically apart from monitering pain and painkillers there is nothing that can be done,was advised gentle exercise as much as possible.maybe a bone scan at a later date.As I was Tripple Negative I have no more meds or treatment,very scary but when I read about how much others are suffering on the hormone drugs,maybe I should be grateful instead of panicked, Allison..xx
Posts.Title: Severe joint pain following chemo. Please help.

Posts.Content: Hi,I had 4 x EC and 4 x Taxotere, nothing else,the Consultant told me that the bone and muscle pain was more than likely from the Taxotere.As I am TN there is no more treatment for me.Allison.x
Posts.Title: Severe joint pain following chemo. Please help.

Posts.Content: I finished radiotherapy almost 3 weeks ago,A new lump has appeared higher up in same breast,feels just like the last one.I thought maybe its scar tissue,but cant work out how id have it in this position,Im trying not to panic,does anyone think its possible that it could be a nasty,considering all the treatment ive just been through....thanks..Allison..xx
Posts.Title: Just finished treatment,found new lump

Posts.Content: Hi,I had 4 x EC then 4 X Taxotere, I started to feel leg bone and muscle pain just before chemo no 7.It is now 6 weeks since I had my last chemo and I am 5 weeks into radiotherapy,Up until 2 weeks ago I had very bad breathing problems and restricted mobility,the leg and muscle pain has eased considerably,I can walk slowly for maybe 20 minutes now,stairs are a struggle but manageable,At the start of my chemo I started on a concoction of vitamin and minerals, every night I take high strength glucosomine and cod liver oil, Not sure how much these are or have helped me,but they can only have done some good.Im sure that it is the Taxotere that has caused the bone and muscle pain.I am due to see an english speaking consultant on monday so will be asking her,I dont take any pain killers as the strong ones make me feel sick and the regular ones dont do anything, Its sad to know that after beating the cancer we are left with a whole new load of ailments to overcome.good luck and best wishes to all,hopefully youl all see some improvement soon.. allison...xxx
Posts.Title: Severe joint pain following chemo. Please help.

Posts.Content: Hi,thanks ladies,as ive only just moved back to the UK I dont have a bcn,have only just registered with a doctor,I went to see him today and ive got an emergancy referal to the local hospital,im told I will be seen within 2 weeks,so I will just have to remain calm and wait and see,hopefully it will be nothing to worry about,xx
Posts.Title: Just finished treatment,found new lump

Posts.Content: Sorry forgot to add,good luck with your last Taxotere Kim,I had 4 sessions of Tax,the last 2 almost finished me off,hope you fair better than I did,started to recover slowly about 4 weeks after last one..xx
Posts.Title: Just finished treatment,found new lump

Posts.Content: Hi,Helen, I forgot to add on my last post,that I note you had 6 x FEC and no change,did they consult with you on this or just tell you thats what you were having,I am managing the EC better than I expected but am really anxious about the taxotere. It is nice to be able to talk to others who have the same type of BC and have been through the harrowingness that is called treatment. Thanks again. allison.xx
Posts.Title: ADVICE NEEDED ON STEROIDS AND PHYSIO

Posts.Content: Hi Char, Well 3rd chemo down 5 to go...yuk......The English speaking nurse was on duty,managed to have a good chat with her,so feeling much better about a few things,She said it was fine for me not to take the steroids and has given me a script for 10 sessions with a physio starting next week,happy days...lol....well hopefully for my arm anyway. She also told me that it would be more advisable to wait until after Radiotherapy to move back to the UK,I knew this made sense,so will arrange a move for September some time I found online a really good informative health site that Drs answer your questions aswell as patients,so have managed to sort out and understand most of the medical terms on my paperwork now. I phoned macmillans,but they didnt seem to know what the tec terms meant on my paperwork,so didnt gte any joy there,wasnt a very productive phone call.maybe when I am basck in the UK their services will be better suited to me.I didnt just want to use them for a good old moan...lol...even though this would have done me the world of good... Well onwards and upwards..... thanks again Allison...xxx
Posts.Title: ADVICE NEEDED ON STEROIDS AND PHYSIO

Posts.Content: Hi Char, Thanks for your reply,Unfortunately I have no BCN nurse.I do know that if I dont feel well I have to go to the hospital,that aside I have bloods taken every Wednesday inbetween chemo and thats it,There is no after care here,you basically have to just get on with it.I wasnt even told I had TNBC,I thought that BC was that,didnt know there was different types,what an eye opener,I worked this out from translating my paperwork on google,which is not the best tool to use for medical words,I have since had it translated by a medical interperitor.Its through this site that I have learnt as much as I have. I am going to phone and hopefully speak to a Macmillan nurse on monday,I would like to move back to the UK now,but dont want to interrupt or delay any treatment,so will wait until the Rads finishes.I will be moving to cardiff,I know of the cancer hospital there,so hopefully will get some advice from Macmillan on how to transfer etc,I have copies of scans and paperwork,I dont know if its the same in the Uk but they seem to give you copies of everything here. My prognosis on paper seems pretty lousy,I think this was calculated by Adjuvent online,I think a lot of my anxiety stems from this,hopefully the macmillan nurse might be able to clarify it for me. I have no social network or friends here,just myself, husband and dog,All family including my daughters and friends in the UK.Its quite a lonely process to go through.Although they are visiting regular and thankgod for skype,these are keeping me sane. Its reasuring to know that yourself and others with TNBC are fairing well.its frightening to think that after rads your in the luck of the gods.but maybe thats better than going through what the women who have to take tamoxifen seem to suffer. Thanks again Allison.xx
Posts.Title: ADVICE NEEDED ON STEROIDS AND PHYSIO

Posts.Content: Hi,I was diagnosed and operated on in December 10,TNBC grade and stage 3,had lumpectomy and  13 lymph nodes removed.the 2nd day after surgery a physio came to see me and showed me exercises,I quickly forgot them and guessed my way through exercise,I live in Germany,the language barrier is a huge problem,but I am managing my way,just. Physio I dont have the energy to try to find a physio and go through the guessing and understanding thing,The problem I have is that if i extend my right arm I can put it straight,when I try to turn my arm it wont and is slightly painful,my arm is still weak,should this have resolved by now and anyone got exercise tips to help. Steroids I am 2 of 8 chemo sessions in 4xEC and 4Tax to be followed by 6wks rads 1st chemo I was poorly for 1 week then not too bad,the steroids made me feel horrendous.I have a port fitted in my chest and before chemo they injected steroid,they gave me tabs to take twice daily for 4 days after 4mg Dex. After 2nd chemo I didnt take the steroids and was only poorly for 3 days,I presumed they were only given for sickness,but now believe they may also have been given to avoid allergic reaction,My 3rd chemo is next wed,If the English speaking nurse is on duty I will ask her,if not I am back to guessing,My question I suppose is:will not taking the steroids cause more harm than good. Would be grateful for any advice. Thanks and best wishes to all.. Allison xx
Posts.Title: ADVICE NEEDED ON STEROIDS AND PHYSIO

Posts.Content: Hi,Helen and Char, Thanks for your advice,I have tried to find specific exercises for my arm online,not having much joy,I will just continue doing gentle stretching etc,I still cant lift any sort of weight,that includes the hoover,lol,so not too bad. The hospital also give me Emend and Omeprazole to take for a few days,these tabs are fine,no reaction.If  the english nurse is not on duty,then I will just avoid taking the steroids again,atleast until the chemo changes to the Taxotere,this I think is more toxic,so hopefully the english speaking Dr or an interperitor will be able to clarify things for me, I am planning on moving back to the UK as soon as possible after treatment,hopefully early September,If I have no delays in any treatment then I think my last week of rads should be end of August the latest.Do you see Oncologist when rads finishes,as there is no more treatment or meds to take. Char, Pleased you are through your treatment,how were you after and how often do you need to be checked ,  Thanks Allison..xxxxx
Posts.Title: ADVICE NEEDED ON STEROIDS AND PHYSIO

Posts.Content: HI Ladies, Has anyone had a port removed,I am moving back to the UK mid August,if I have my port removed here(Germany) it will be in the days just before I move,Im concerned that it may debilitate me for a while,with packing and removal to sort plus the 10 hour drive,When I had the port fitted it was very painful for about a week,the bruising was very bad, Is it as painful to remove,I have been told that if I wait until I return to the UK it could be months before I get it removed if they agree to do it at all.I have a lot of discomfort especially when I lay down,so really removal cant come soon enough. Thanks.Allison.x
Posts.Title: Port Removal

Posts.Content: Thanks Celia, I guess i,ll suffer anything if it means having the port removed sooner rather than later.will just make sure I am very organised with the packing etc before removal,I can arrange the op to have the port taken out the week after radiotherapy,that will give me a couple of days to recoupe before the long drive back,Excellant news for you on the all clear, allison.x
Posts.Title: Port Removal
